Negative credits can arise when a firm is considering an increase in its R&D spending that will leave it below the base in its current year, but expects to be above the base in subsequent years. No tax credits will accrue from the increase in R&D in the current year, but the increased base will reduce the size of the credit in subsequent years.
Other countries have put an absolute cap on how much tax credit a company can receive in a single year — for example, in France the ceiling is FFr40 million.
